columns.name: ${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id related to modw.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}s.

columns.name: year
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The year of the ${AGGREGATION_UNIT}

columns.name: ${AGGREGATION_UNIT}
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The ${AGGREGATION_UNIT} of the year.

columns.name: application_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The application that the job ran. This value is autodetected based on the job executable path. A value of uncategorized indicates that the executable path was not recognized as a community application. A value of PROPRIETARY is shown for any application that has a non-open licence agreement that may restrict publishing of performance data. NA means not available.

columns.name: block_sda_rd_bytes
columns.comment: FACT: The total bytes per second read by block devices in this period.

columns.name: block_sda_rd_bytes_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: block_sda_rd_ios
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of read io operations per second by block devices in this period.

columns.name: block_sda_rd_ios_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: block_sda_wr_bytes
columns.comment: FACT: The total bytes per second written by block devices in this period.

columns.name: block_sda_wr_bytes_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: block_sda_wr_ios
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of write io operations by block devices in this period.

columns.name: block_sda_wr_ios_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: catastrophe_bucket_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: indicator L1D cache load drop off (smaller is worse)

columns.name: cores
columns.comment: DIMENSION: Number of processor cores each of the jobs used.

columns.name: cpibucket_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The number of cpu clock ticks per instruction on average per core.

columns.name: cpiref_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The weight for jobs with cpi counts that ran during the period

columns.name: cpiref_weighted_by_coreseconds
columns.comment: FACT: Total cpiref core seconds.

columns.name: cpldref_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The weight for jobs with cpld counts that ran during the period

columns.name: cpldref_weighted_by_coreseconds
columns.comment: FACT: Total cpldref core seconds.

columns.name: cpu_time
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of the cpu_time of the jobs pertaining to this period. If a job took more than one period, its cpu_time is distributed linearly across the periods it spans.

columns.name: cpu_time_idle
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of the idle cpu_time of the jobs pertaining to this period.

columns.name: cpu_time_system
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of the system cpu_time of the jobs pertaining to this period.

columns.name: cpu_time_user
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of the user cpu_time of the jobs pertaining to this period.

columns.name: cpu_usage_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The core weight for jobs with cpu user values that ran during the period

columns.name: cpu_user_bucketid
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The ratio of user cpu time to total cpu time for the cores that the job was assigned.

columns.name: cpu_user_cv_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: Coefficient of variation for the CPU user for all cores that were assigned to the job.

columns.name: cpu_user_cv_weighted_core_seconds
columns.comment: FACT: cpu user CV * core seconds.

columns.name: cpu_user_imbalance_weighted_core_seconds
columns.comment: FACT: Total cpu user imbalance core seconds.

columns.name: datasource_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The software used to collect the performance data.

columns.name: exit_status_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The exit status of the job reported by the job scheduler. The meaning of this field depends on the job scheduler.

columns.name: flop
columns.comment: FACT: The total floating point operations per core in this period.

columns.name: flop_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The core weight for jobs with flops counts that ran during the period

columns.name: fos_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: config://hierarchy.json:bottom_level_info

columns.name: gpu0_nv_utilization
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of gpu time of the jobs pertaining to this period.

columns.name: gpu0_nv_utilization_bucketid
columns.comment: DIMENSION: average % utilization of the gpu

columns.name: gpu0_nv_utilization_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with cpu user values that ran during the period

columns.name: granted_pe
columns.comment: DIMENSION: number of granted processing elements (i.e. wayness)

columns.name: ib_rx_bytes
columns.comment: FACT: The total bytes per second written by block devices in this period.

columns.name: ib_rx_bytes_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with ib_rx_bytes counts that ran during this period

columns.name: ibrxbyterate_bucket_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: number of bytes received per node over the data interconnect

columns.name: job_count
columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that ended during this period.

columns.name: jobtime_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: Job time is bucketing of wall time based on prechosen intervals in the modw.job_times table.

columns.name: max_mem_bucketid
columns.comment: DIMENSION: Maximum ratio of memory used to total memory available for the compute node with the highest peak memory usage

columns.name: mem_transferred
columns.comment: FACT: Total memory transferred.

columns.name: mem_transferred_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The weight for jobs with mem_transferred counts that ran during the period

columns.name: mem_usage_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The core weight for jobs with memory usage values that ran during the period

columns.name: mem_used_including_os_caches_weighted_by_duration
columns.comment: FACT: The total memory seconds used in byte seconds by the OS including the page and buffer caches in this period.

columns.name: mem_used_weighted_by_duration
columns.comment: FACT: The total memory seconds used in byte seconds in this period. This value indicates the memory used by all processes including system services. It does not include the memory used by the OS page or buffer cache.

columns.name: net_eth0_rx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes received by network via network interface i in this period.

columns.name: net_eth0_rx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: net_eth0_tx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes transmitted by by network via network interface i in this period.

columns.name: net_eth0_tx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: net_ib0_rx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes received by network via network interface i in this period.

columns.name: net_ib0_rx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: net_ib0_tx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes transmitted by by network via network interface i in this period.

columns.name: net_ib0_tx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_rx
columns.comment: FACT: The total bytes received by network drive i in this period.

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_rx_bucket_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: total number of bytes received per node from the :label_1 filesystem.

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_rx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_tx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes transmitted by network drive i in this period.

columns.name: netdrv_gpfs_tx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_rx
columns.comment: FACT: The total bytes received by network drive i in this period.

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_rx_bucket_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: total number of bytes received per node from the :label_1 filesystem.

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_rx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_tx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes transmitted by network drive i in this period.

columns.name: netdrv_isilon_tx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_rx
columns.comment: FACT: The total bytes received by network drive i in this period.

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_rx_bucket_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: total number of bytes received per node from the :label_1 filesystem.

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_rx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_tx
columns.comment: FACT: The total number of bytes transmitted by network drive i in this period.

columns.name: netdrv_panasas_tx_weight
columns.comment: FACT: The node weight for jobs with :field_name counts that ran during this period

columns.name: node_time
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of the node_time of the jobs pertaining to this period. If a job took more than one period, its node_time is distributed linearly across the periods it spans.

columns.name: nodecount_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: foreign key to the nodecount table.

columns.name: organization_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The organization that owns the resource on which the job ran.

columns.name: person_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The name of the job owner.

columns.name: person_organization_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The name of the organization of the job owner.

columns.name: piperson_organization_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The organization of the job owner's PI.

columns.name: principalinvestigator_person_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The PI of the job owner.

columns.name: processorbucket_id
columns.comment: FACT: Processor bucket or job size buckets are prechosen in the modw.processor_buckets table.

columns.name: queue_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The name of the queue to which the job was submitted.

columns.name: requested_wall_time
columns.comment: FACT: The requested wall time of the jobs that were running during this period. This will only count the walltime of the jobs that fell during the period.

columns.name: resource_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The resource that ran the job.

columns.name: running_job_count
columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that were running during this period.

columns.name: shared
columns.comment: DIMENSION: Whether the job ran on a node that ran at least one other job.

columns.name: started_job_count
columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that started during this period.

columns.name: submitted_job_count
columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that started during this period.

columns.name: sum_weighted_expansion_factor
columns.comment: FACT: The sum of expansion factor per job multiplied by nodecount and the [adjusted] duration of jobs that ran in this period.

columns.name: systemaccount_id
columns.comment: DIMENSION: The username on the resource of the user that ran the job. May be a UID or string username depending on the resource.

columns.name: wait_time
columns.comment: FACT: The amount of time jobs waited to execute during this period.

columns.name: wall_time
columns.comment: FACT: The wall_time of the jobs that were running during this period. This will only count the walltime of the jobs that fell during the period.
